metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0667 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When the vulnerability is triggered the BIND process will exit. BIND 9.18.0

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libisccc160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
liblwres160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.16').
